Description: Sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery globular aryballos consisting of mouth, handle and shoulder; exterior: tongue pattern between bands on top of mouth; neck glazed; on shoulder, traces of tongue pattern; below, band of double staggered dots between black bands; below, part of undetermined black-figure decoration with possible traces of added red.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 122, pl. XXXVII, no. 344.2)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 229, no. 152)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.285) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4741 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
